Caption: Figure 2: A comparison between TRON (blue solid line) and SV M perf (red dotted line). The y-axis shows the accuracy differences between current models and that of using the stopping tolerance 0.1. The x-axis (training time) is in seconds. We use C = 1. One must be careful that SV M perf ’s C parameter is different. We take our C value and set SV M perf ’s C parameter as Cl/100.

and testing accuracy. Since accuracy stabilizes for thresholds/tolerances smaller
than 0.1, the accuracies obtained from these solutions can be taken to be very close
to those of the true minima. So we check against these accuracy values as training
time increases from zero. Figure 2 shows the results for real-sim and rcv1. We
do not present results for other data sets as for unknown reasons SVMperf needs
lengthy time for predicting data with a large number of features (e.g., news20 and
yahoo-japan).
